page.title: 19THE ANIMAL HEALTH TRUST
page.content: This charity whose patron is the Queen, was originally founded in 1942 to help veterinary students when it was called the Veterinary Educational Trust. Since 1946 it has gone on to investigate, the diagnosis, cure, and prevention, of diseases in animals. "That's the phrase that really sums it up," says publicity officer Mrs. J. Harwood. The Small Animal Centre is in Kennet, and the Equine Research Centre in Newmarket. There are about 12 vets working at the Animal Health Trust. The main diseases they are investigating at present, are eye problems in dogs. For instance, pedigree dogs need to be checked for hereditary eye problems. They're also interested in cancer in cats and dogs.
